justification: The article notes that “recent technological innovations have made the application of 4E research questions more practical, such as the emergence of Mobile Brain/Body Imaging (MoBI)…” indicating MoBI is used to measure cognition outside the lab.
In the same sentence the authors list “Exposomics” alongside MoBI as a new tool, showing it is the measurement strategy for capturing environmental factors relevant to cognitive or health research.
construct: Environmental exposures in cognition and health

justification: The text states that “cognitive research should always include psychophysiological and neurobehavioral measures,” directly tying these measurement types to studying embodiment in cognition.

Discussing chronic pain, the authors write, “Markers like allodynia and hyperalgesia indicate pain perception dysfunction,” explicitly identifying these clinical tests as measures of the pain construct.
construct: Pain perception dysfunction in chronic pain
